RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 13500. (PLUS UP TO $6,750 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races W here Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAR ENTRY broke sharply and settled in behind the dueling leaders entering the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, shifted three wide leaving the turn, and closed with a rush to prove best. I'M CORFU away well and pressed the pace from the outside of FINDING WAYS entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide through the final turn, began to get the better of his pace rival entering the lane, but had little left when tackled and overtaken in mid stretch, while proving clearly second best. FINDING WAYS away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, struggled to keep tabs on his pace rival entering the lane, and faded in the stretch drive. RACING RIVER was unprepared at the start, and got away poorly, and trailed the field throughout. The stewards conducted a review into the start of the race, but deemed that all horses received a fair start.

ENTRY.NAME: Finding Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Corfu
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed 2 w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Star Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLY BOY JACK tracked the leader in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly one out from the rail in the drive to as he wore down the pacesetter late and inched clear to prove best. STANFORD NORTH away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside through the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off a late surge by FLY BOY JACK while proving clearly second best. BORROWED EQUITY settled at the back of the pack while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed from just off the rail to garner a share. DAPPER DON broke sharply, but was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backside, rallied four wide into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. SHOWMAN away well and stalked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Stanford North
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Fly Boy Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, rallied 4w, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Borrowed Equity
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Ballerina S. HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 91. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR AGE STAKES FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $200 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, September 30, 2023, with $1,500 to enter and $2,000 to start. $100,000 guaranteed of which 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. Preference will be based on current year earnings as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Weights: T hree Year Olds: 120 lbs. Older: 124 lbs. Field will be limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INFINITE PATIENCE tracked the leader from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to track the pacesetter from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, took control midway through the turn, and inched clear over the final furlong under confident handling. ABOVE AVERAGE away well and tracked the leader three wide through the stretch the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. WE B THREE stalked the leaders from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, maintained her position while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response late. PRETTY ARIA away alertly and stalked the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, dropped back to trail in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. DAPHNE broke sharply and raced to the lead one out from the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace from the two path through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, was overtaken soon after entering the final turn, and faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Daphne
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: We B Three
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Infinite Patience
ENTRY.OWNER: Decoursey William and R N H Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, led, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Aria
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 wide, trailed, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Above Average
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 w, rallied 2 w, closed 2w, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Claiming Purse 16000. (PLUS UP TO $8,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs . (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SET TO SHINE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, maintained his advantage into the final turn, and drew clear in the lane under confident handling. SMART LAD broke sharply and forced the pace from the outside of SET TO SHINE entering the first turn, chased the leader in the run down the backside, struggled to match strides with the pacesetter while racing two wide entering the final turn, but closed two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. PRINCE CAIRO settled well off the leaders while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to garner a share. FLORIDA GATOR settled off the early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. WANDALITA settled off the early pace while racing between rivals entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but weakened in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Set to Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Prince Cairo
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wandalita
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Florida Gator
ENTRY.OWNER: Potozny Larry Langelaan Peter and Wil - A - Way Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS THE HYPE broke sharply and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained a tracking trip in the run down the backside, shifted four wide to take up the chase entering the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to get up in time. OSTRACIZE stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, began to advance three wide midway down the backstretch, battled for the lead three wide through the turn, assumed control leaving the turn, but was unable to sustain her early bid in the closing strides in a game effort. TOBESUNNY stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to get up for a share. BAKFIRE BABY away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, continued to battle for the lead from along the rail entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. BAKZONE away well and pressed the pace through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but faded in the late going. WALKINTHEWALK unhurried early while trailing the field into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, was always well back and failed to make a late impact. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of BAKZONE lodged a claim of foul against the rider of OSTRACIZE for alleged interference on the final turn. after review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Walkinthewalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Ostracize
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 w, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, rallied 4 w, closed 3w, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Premier's H. - Grade3 HASTINGS RACE 6 1 3/8M Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $200 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, September 30, 2023 with an additional $1,500 to enter and $2,000 to start. $100,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. High Weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 will be used in determining preferen ce of horses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUNBIRD tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, raced in a stalking trip through the stretch the second time and in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid smartly three wide entering the final turn, took control entering the stretch and quickly drew clear as much the best. AT ATTENTION pressed the pace from the outside of JUST JIMMY in the run down the backstretch the first time, continued to force the issue through the stretch the second time and in the run down the backside, continued that battle into the final turn, began to get the better of his pace rival leaving the turn, but was quickly overtaken by SUNBIRD entering the lane, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. ACCIDENTAL HERO stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch the first time, maintained his position through the stretch the second time and in the run down the backside, rallied three wide through the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive to garner a share. JUST JIMMY away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail in the run down the backstretch the first time, continued to set a pressured pace from along the rail through the third turn and in the run down the backstretch the final turn, continued that battle into the final turn, struggled to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and faded in the late stages. BIG UNION settled off the contested early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backside the first time, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. PAY MY WAY unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the backstretch the first time, continued to bide his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside the second time, rallied from just off the rail entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. ITSMYDAY settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch the first time, held his position through the stretch the second time, rallied four wide entering the final turn, but was never a serious factor. STAY FANTASTIC stalked the leaders into the backstretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained his position while continuing to save ground throughout, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Pay My Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Big Union
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, close 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sunbird
ENTRY.OWNER: Felicella Pauline and Estate of Nick Felicella
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: At Attention
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Just Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Accidental Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Itsmyday
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Su ch A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LASTING LIGHT away alertly and raced to the lead one out from the rail entering the backside, set a pressured pace from the inside of ANIMA in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, opened a clear lead entering the lane, but was all out to hold off a late surge by CARLA'S HONOR to prevail. CARLA'S HONOR was bumped solidly in the opening strides before assuming a stalking trip from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail through the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the rail in the drive to just miss. ROSE OF TEXAS away well and stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backside, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. ANIMA rushed up three wide entering the first turn to force the issue from the outside of LASTING LIGHT entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival through the final turn, but was outfinished late. TEXAS HUMOR settled off the contested early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. FILLY FATALE broke sharply and tracked the leaders in the run down the backside while saving ground at the rail, continued to save ground entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response over the final furlong. DON'TPASSTHEPEPPER settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to respond when called upon. ICE BREAKER unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Bill Breen Racing and Elder Matt
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied inside, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: Carla's Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied inside, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Don'tpassthepepper
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,
